flawed_nl_solution:
There will be $1000 x 3/10 = $<<1000*3/10=10000/3>>10000/3 worth of money that will be changed into $50 bills.
Uncle Bradley will have $10000/3/$50 = <<10000/3/50=200/3>>200/3 pieces of $50 bills.
He will change $1000 - $10000/3 = $<<1000-10000/3=-7000/3>>-7000/3 worth of money into $100 bills.
So there will be $-7000/3/$100 = <<-7000/3/100=-70/3>>-70/3 pieces of $100 bills.
Thus, there will be a total of 200/3 + -70/3 = <<200/3+-70/3=130/3>>130/3 pieces of $50 and $100 bills in all.
#### 130/3

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300, not 10000/3. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
